key_points: Tiger Woods has shown significant recovery progress since his car crash in February.
Woods was seen on a golf course over the weekend, indicating improvement.
He suffered significant orthopedic injuries to his right lower extremity during the accident.
Woods has been doing physical therapy and reports that the pain is now very manageable.
He remains optimistic about returning to tour, though no specific timeline has been shared.
Woods aims to return to competitive golf, acknowledging it's a significant goal for him.
His spirits are described as really great, feeling optimistic about the recovery.
Woods was spotted watching his son Charlie in a junior tournament, with his girlfriend Erica Herman at his side.
Los Angeles County Sheriff stated that speed was the primary cause of Woods' crash, with no signs of impairment.
In his first interview since the accident, Woods focused on walking on his own as his immediate goal.
spokespersons: Anish Mahajan, MD, Chief Medical Officer at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center
